result.title: Unsolved Problems From ACM-ICPC Asia-Amritapuri Regional 2017 Contest
result.content:
Hello there,

Me and my friends were solving last yearsACM-ICPC Asia-Amritapuri Regional Contest problems. At last we got stuck in these two problems. Turns out, the Editorial is not out yet. So i was hoping to discuss these two problems here.

A Simple Polygon https://www.codechef.com/problems/SIMPPOLY

and

Sliding Puzzle https://www.codechef.com/problems/AMPUZZLE

For the "A Simple Polygon" we were thinking of doing a Delaunay Triangulation in nlog(n) and printing out 500 diagonals from it. But i dunno, Maybe, that is an overkill for this problem. Also is there any good implementation of Delaunay Triangulation in nlog(n) out there, which is worth putting in my notebook?

Any sort of help is appreciated. TIA.
